fields.description:
After performing a merge in a Mercurial repository, but prior to committing, merged files are displayed twice in the pending files list and commit window.  Once with a 'modified' icon and again with a 'merged' icon.

I believe the issue may stem from a different path separator being used for merged files and modified files.

From the attached screenshot, you can see that one entry uses \ when the other uses /
fields.summary: When merging, modified files are listed twice in the pending changes view

fields.description: Cannot seem to finish a feature with Git Flow.  When the option is selected, the popup first appears with the name of the feature selected (see Screenshot1.png), then quickly changes to show no available features in the menu and OK is greyed out (see Screenshot2.png).  If OK is quickly selected before the feature disappears, the finish fails with the message shown in Screenshot3.png.  I only recently started using Git Flow with this release, but this has now occurred with all (3) features that I have tried.  It also does not seem to matter if I have the feature checked out (as in the pictures) or another branch (which I tried, and the only difference is no feature is ever shown in the popup menu in the latter case).
fields.summary: Git Flow Finish Feature Not Working

fields.description:
Using a bitbucket account with normal username and password. IE is set to use a corporate proxy via the option to use an automatic configuration script. If I turn this off, I can use my account set to either SSH or HTTPS to browse. Turn the proxy back on, and then attempting to browse any repositories via the built in browser gives this error:

The following errors were encountered: The 'BR' start tag on line 6 position 30 does not match the end tag of 'FONT'. Line 7, position 3. See attached.

See also: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/311716/sourcetree-strange-error-when-testing-connections

There are no log files generated that I can see.
fields.summary: When using corporate proxy config script, cannot browse Bitbucket via HTTPS or SSH

fields.description:
version 1.6.2003.0

When I choose Modify, or repair, SourceTree does not get updated because of a failure in installed components. 

I do not know of a woraround.

Cinking on the install automatically checkbox does nothing, I would have liked to try executing the installer manually. 

Where is the installer downloaded ?
fields.summary: Choosing repair in installation update does not install latest update.
Check for updates prompts with confusing modify repare remove dialog

fields.description:
Whenever I try to edit a commit on the rebase window, I get a "rebase --abort" right after I leave the screen.

I'm following the instructions to edit a commit found here (checking the "ammend commit" checkbox): http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/06/interactive-rebase-sourcetree/

I ended up doing this by command line, and everything worked as expected, so I believe this a bug in SourceTree. I also tried with many repositories and got the same thing.

I also reported this in Atlassian Answers: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/321956/interactively-rebase-always-aborting
fields.summary: Interactively rebase always aborting

fields.description: Happens with both beta 2 and beta 3.  Always happens if there are modifications in the working copy but often happens with a clean working copy too.
fields.summary: SourceTree beta crashes at startup with Mercurial repository visible

fields.description: Commit history isn't hilighted when I mouseover on the commit history. I was wondering if you could let them be hilighted when I mouseover it. thanks.
fields.summary: Commit History Not Hilighted

fields.description:
We are using SourceTree with GitHub.  The repository on the remote got rename while why client was still running.

After the rename clicking on the client crashed the client.
fields.summary: Renamed Repo name in remote crashes SourceTree Client

fields.description:
- Install a previous version of SourceTree for Windows.
- Make sure to pin the shortcut to the taskbar.
- Start SourceTree and do the auto update.
- After the update, notice that the taskbar icon is gone.
fields.summary: Taskbar shortcut dissapears when upgrading SourceTree in Windows 7

fields.description: There is no information in SourceTree interface about automatic update of repository. I think it is needed to show progress bar or info in status bar when repository is synced in background.
fields.summary: Show progress bar or info in status bar when repo is synced automatically

fields.description: Whenever a file in my working directory is modified or I refresh my UI manually, the split-panel dividers reset their positions. I want to have my dividers set up the way I like but I can't do that because they always keep resetting themselves. This is extremely frustrating
fields.summary: UI dividers keep resetting themselves

fields.description:
As a user of SourceTree, I want to see commits that were made while detached, so that I can easily recover lost commits after I switch back to a branch.


Conditions of Satisfaction:

When I am in the 'Log / History' tab, I have an option to 'Show Dangling Commits'.

When I enable to 'Show Dangling Commits' option, I can see commits that occurred without a branch or tag attached.


Notes:

Steps to lose a commit:
1. Checkout a change that isn't on a branch by double-clicking it.
2. Answer 'OK' to the 'Confirm change working copy' dialog
3. Make a commit
4. Checkout a branch by double-clicking on it's name.

Results:
The previous commit is gone from the UI without an easy way to find it.

Currently the only way to recover a lost commit is to use the terminal. Since I'm not familiar with the git command line, I needed to do some research. My current work-around is:
1. Option the command line.
2. Type 'git reflog'
3. Find the commit that no longer shows up in SourceTree
4. Cherry-pick or merge in the commit using it's shortened id in the reflog.

If the dangling commit showed up in the UI, It would be much easier to recover.

Honestly, I think this option should be on by default so newbs like me aren't as likely to lose their work.
fields.summary: View Dangling Commits Option

fields.description: After each start of Sourcetree I have to selected the "Flat list (multiple columns)". It seems this settings isn't saved. Please save list settings by repository!
fields.summary: List view settings aren't saved

fields.description: I usually work in "Log / HIstory" mode to see all commits and changes. Now when I commit changes, the tab isn't restored after entering commit message. It's really annoying to have to manual go back to the right tab!
fields.summary: Commit doesn't restore tab

fields.description:
Sorry for the bad repro steps on this report.

I have observed various problems with the new commit experience. Most notably, when I stage files from the File Status tab it doesn't show the files as being staged until I close and then re-open the tab again. This is not consistent behaviour, and at this point I haven't tracked down the situations where it happens.

I've had a related (but maybe separate?) issue where the File Status tab doesn't show modified files, regardless of when I select "Show only: modified" or "Show only: pending". When I switch to SourceTree 1.5.2 it shows the pending files as expected. Again this is not consistent behaviour, but I haven't narrowed down the situations.
fields.summary: Commit window doesn't refresh consistently

fields.description:
When I deselect "Push all tags to remote" in Options > Git, every time I push it still has all branches checked by default.

With the same setting in SourceTree 1.5.2.0, only the active branch is checked by default.
fields.summary: "Push all tags to remote" setting not working

fields.description:
It is not possible to enter linebreaks in the textarea. Even when pasting multiline content only the first row is displayed.

It would be great if linebreaks where posible, especially when squashing commits.
fields.summary: No linebreaks in "Edit Message" dialog during interactive rebase

fields.description:
Add support for git notes: http://schacon.github.com/git/git-notes.html
Requested here: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/38917/please-support-git-notes

--> also on SourceTree for Windows (see Mac: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREE-917)

Would be wonderful! Thanks
fields.summary: Git notes support

fields.description: Sourcetree looks out of place on Windows. From its icon, through to the interface itself - the application needs a solid update in this area. GitHub 2.0 recently launched, and whilst not as solid, it looks amazing.
fields.summary: Needs refreshed UI to match Windows 7/8/future

fields.description: Crashes always at start. Window is visible but one of the mercurial project shows empty info.
fields.summary: Crash at start

fields.description:
I'm experiencing an intermittent authentication issue when trying to push, pull, and fetch. This started happening 8/4, but after a while of researching the issue, it went away on its own. The issue came back today after I successfully pulled develop branch, but prevented me from pulling master branch. 

The authentication window prompting me to login to bitbucket.org appears when I attempt to pull. The user name is correct and the password is empty. I enter the password, which I know is correct, and the prompt goes away for few seconds then reappears in the same fashion.

I'm not sure if this is related, but under Tools>Options>Authentication, there are no usernames or passwords listed.
fields.summary: Authentication prompt prevents pull/push/fetch

I was pushing some tags to origin, after having created a tag with the 'push to origin' checkbox set.
Then I closed the 'Tags' folder in the UI and it crashed.
fields.summary: Crashed when pushing tags and closing tag 'folder' in ui.

fields.description:
Hello,

split bars on the UI keep resetting to default after every single push / pull / commit actions. It is *reeeeally* frustrating, since I need to keep moving them around in order to see details on all different panels.

I haven't seen an option to make these split bars stick to where they are. Do you have any plans to do this in the future ?

Regards,
Julien
fields.summary: UI view splitbars reset on every push/pull/commit

fields.description:
When discarding selected changes from a file, either a hunk or selected line(s), SourceTree does the discard and then converts all linebreaks in the complete file from CRLF (Windows) to LF.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
I used a fresh created repository so everyone should be able to reproduce the steps on the own computer.

* Create new repository
* Set autocrlf=false in {{.git/config}} to make sure the files are commited as-is.
* Create a file with CRLF line endings, add some text in four or five lines.
** Commit the file.
* Now we need to use a clone where autocrlf=true. This is simply done by another change in {{.git/config}} manually. The effect is the same as cloning the repository on a machine where autocrlf=true globally.
* Change a line in the file
* In SourceTree, click on _Discard Hunk_

*Expected:* The changes are simply discarded, no changes are in working copy.
*Actual:* The changes are discarded, but all line endings have been converted to LF.

Note that this does not happen when discarding the whole file.

h3. Comments on expectations
You may state that the error is caused due to inconsistent use of autocrlf throughout the repository clones. But actions on my clone should be independent of what was checked in by others. I have clear expectations on the autocrlf functionality:
* on checking out every LF is converted into CRLF
* CRLF line endings are preserved (not converted into CRCRLF)
* on commiting every CRLF is converted back into LF

These auto-changes have impact on the actions _checkout_ and _commit_. I do not expect SourceTree to mess with my working copy on _discard_ actions other than the assigned task. Instead in the above case, I expect that SourceTree discards the hunk (or selected lines) and reinstates the content of the file which is currently in the repository. That leaves two possibilities how it can be done:
# reinstate the original content without regarding autocrlf, which could leave me (for LF formatted files) with LF endings -- not desirable
# checkout the original content with autocrlf applying afterwards (LF to CRLF), which would give me the content but with CRLF line endings

SourceTree does none of the above. Instead it seems to apply the *reverse* autocrlf action after discarding the changes. The contents are prepared for a commit (everything in LF), where I expect the contents prepared to as after a checkout (everything in CRLF).

h3. Additional comments

This issue is the same as SRCTREEWIN-988 which was closed with "resolved locally" or (in my understanding) "cannot reproduce" by a developer. So I tried to provide the steps that use a fresh repository. Please ask if questions are left.

Also SRCTREEWIN-1635 seems to describe this bug, but misses the exact circumstances. It was stated as an error with SVN to Git conversion and no further reason was declared. This is not valid here because I used a new repository.
fields.summary: Undesired conversion of line endings of whole file when discarding selected lines (CR-LF to LF)

fields.description: Internal CA's that are installed at the OS level are still not trusted by Git and SourceTree (see [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SOURCETREEKB/Resolving+SSL+Self-Signed+Certificate+Errors]). SourceTree should use the trusted certificates that are available at the OS level so that certificates do not have to be manually trusted like in the documentation above.
fields.summary: SourceTree should trust internal CA that are available at the OS level

fields.description:
When i choose pull and switch which branch to pull from, SourceTree disregards the settings about using rebase and unchecks the checkbox.

The results of this is if one is not careful to each time check the rebase option that you do a merge instead.
fields.summary: Pulling from other branches removed Rebase option

fields.description:
* I added a repository to SourceTree, then manually (via command line) added a submodule in it. The submodule doesn't appear in the sidebar.

* I added the submodule to the repo before importing the repo into SourceTree. Nothing

* I added a new submodule in the repo from SourceTree, using the "Add Submodule..." option when right-clicking the sidebar. The submodule is added correctly, I commit and push it. NO SUBREPOS ARE SHOWN IN THE SIDEBAR :(

Notice in the attached image: The current HEAD has 2 submods in the .gitmodules file, and the directory of the 2nd was just added. Nothing on the sidebar. It's supposed to look like this: http://blog.sourcetreeapp.com/2012/02/01/using-submodules-and-subrepositories/
fields.summary: Git submodules are not being displayed in sidebar

fields.description:
I have a shared repo with over 1000 dev branches, not my choice :), and when expanding/collapsing the remote branches SourceTree will crash occasionally. I have attached the sourcetree.log file.

Let me know if I can give any other details.
fields.summary: Crash with 1000+ branches

fields.description:
When working through a set of files on the File Status tab the differences are shown to the right hand side with Stage File and Discard File buttons at the top by the filename.

These buttons are aligned to the end of the filename so when working through each file where the file names have different lengths these buttons move from left to right.

When checking the differences of a number of files this movement can be frustrating as it means I have to take focus from the differences window to where the buttons are and reposition the mouse when they have moved. I've hit Discard File a number of times because the mouse was over Stage File for the previous file but the new filename is shorter and Discard File moved itself to under my mouse.

Also when inspecting a file with a lot of changes and scrolling to the bottom of the file the Stage & Discard File buttons are removed from view by the scrolling, which means than when I get to the end and I'm happy to stage the file I find myself scrolling up again to be able to get to the buttons.

Ideally I would be able to keep the mouse in one place, not having to look where it was to be able to stage one file after another down the working copy changes list.
fields.summary: Difference window for File Status tab, Stage File and Discard File buttons usability issues

fields.description:
my Git folder is C:\Program Files (x86)\IBM\Notes\Data\workspace\GIT\fdt-skills-and-roles-2

Right clicking on the bookmark ans selecting "Show in Explorer" opens This PC\Documents

Works OK in Windows 7 and used very regularly to update documentation within the git repo.

This is a fresh install of ST on a fresh install of Windows 8
fields.summary: right click and "Show in Explorer" does not open correct folder

fields.description:
Source tree crashed when attempting to push subtree (right click on subtree in UI). Log attached.
Push seemed to work fine after restart of sourcetree.
fields.summary: crash

fields.description: See attached log
fields.summary: SourceTree Crashed when trying to pull changes

fields.description:
We are encouraging the use of user forks in Stash as a means to encourage teams to allow casual contribution to projects in an open source style model. We encouraged users to use SourceTree on Windows as it is a very good client.

One of these users tried to come up with a workflow for the team he represents and discovered that the "Hosted Repositories" feature in SourceTree doesn't seem to offer the option of listing user repositories. It seems that it lists all the projects, but doesn't list the "user profile" as a project, and therefore does not allow any user repositories to be cloned?

This request is to add support for the "user profile" / "user repositories" in the "Stash Hosted Repositories" capability.
fields.summary: Hosted repository support for Stash does not list user repositories (such as user forks)

fields.description:
Unable to clone a repository. 

Please see the attached screenshots.

After selecting a Bitbucket repository, "Repository Type" shows a message "This is not a valid source path/url". Clicking on "Details.." button shows an empty message box.

Also, "Clone" button remains disabled.
fields.summary: Can't Clone repository

fields.description:
Recently I've been prompted over and over to Authenticate, even when remember password is checked.

It says
Login Required for: bitbucket.org
username: moak

I am connected to a bunch of repos, and I don't know which one is prompting the password again and again. This is probably due to the fact that I was removed as contributor from a project.

It would help immensely if I knew which repository specifically is issuing the prompt.
fields.summary: Identify Repository that is prompting for Login

fields.description:
Using git flow I create a new branch out of my development, I then write something in that branch and want to finish the feature. I have set "do not fast forward when merging, always create commit" in the options window so I would have a commit for the feature and another for the merge of the feature to the develop branch.
So the expected result is this:
A----------C
\----B-----/
where B is a new feature

If I use the finish feature under git flow, the 2nd commit is not created, instead I only get A-----B (although "do not fast forward when merging, always create commit" is set in the options)

If I use the merge button and not the git flow button then the expected result is achieved.

I think both buttons should yield the same result
fields.summary: Git flow and fast forward

fields.description: SourceTree crashes when one of the File Status, Branches, Tags, Branches, or Stashes collapsible stacks is clicked after a Fetch.
fields.summary: Collapsing one of the File Status, Tags, Branches, etc. collapsible stacks after Fetching from a remote repository crashes SourceTree

fields.description:
I created a Custom Action 

Menu Caption: Open in Sublime
Script to run: C:\Program Files\Sublime Text 3\sublime_text.exe
Parameters: $FILE

When I run the Custom Action  it correctly opens the file in Sublime.
However, the Open in Sublime Window stays open and must be canceled in order to use SourceTree. (See image attached)
But if I cancel the window Sublime closes too.

A workaround seems to be to open Sublime before running the Custom Action and then the cancel window doesn't stay open.
fields.summary: Custom Action for Sublime stays in the foreground and has to be cancelled

fields.description:
powershell scripts are created in an unsupported encoding.

Applications that create the scripts are:
PowerGui Script Editor
Windows Powershell ISE

SourceTree reports these files as unmodified.
fields.summary: UCS-2 Big\Little Endian Encoding Support

fields.description: It kept crashing - so, I updated to the latest version. Updating to the latest version didn't help!
fields.summary: SourceTree keeps crashing

fields.description:
As a user of SourceTree, I want to browse and create remote repositories for my existing local repository from the 'Add Remote' dialog, so that I can quickly set up and share my code remotely without leaving the 'Add Remote' dialog.

Conditions of Satisfaction:

When I go to the 'Remotes' tab of the 'Repository Settings' dialog and click the 'Add' button, I can access the same 'Browse Hosted Projects' button from the 'Clone / Add / Create Repository' dialog.

When I select an existing repo in the 'Browse Hosted Projects' button, it is added as a remote repository to the local repo I'm currently editing.

When I click the 'Browse Hosted Projects' button, I can select the 'Create New Repository...' button and create a new repository just as I can currently in the 'Clone / Add / Create Repository' dialog.

When I've created a new repository, it is added as a remote repository to the local repo I'm currently editing.
fields.summary: 'Browse Hosted Projects' from 'Add Remotes' Dialog

fields.description: I had just checked out a branch from our stash server.  I clicked on the expander for "Remotes" (to close it) and SourceTree crashed.
fields.summary: Crashed while checking out remote branch
bug

fields.description: As a SourceTree user, when viewing the list of commits in a Git repository, I would love to be able to filter the Descriptions with a search field.
fields.summary: Filter commits

fields.description:
1. SourceTree was running
2. In stash, clicked "clone in sourcetree"
3. Sourcetree asked for login
4. Entered password and clicked login
5. Sourcetree crashed

Log file attached
fields.summary: sourcetree crashed when cloning repository from stash

fields.description: SourceTree currently does not allow a feature to be finished if there are uncommitted changes. Remove this restriction to allow a feature to be completed if there are existing commits for the feature.
fields.summary: Allow feature to be completed with unstaged changes

fields.description:
There doesn't appear to be a direct way (e.g. from right-click menu) to ignore only the local changes to a file.  In Git, this is accomplished with "git update-index --assume-unchanged <file>".  This is very useful to keep settings or property files from showing up in the Working Copy Changes list, and thus avoid accidentally pushing up personal passwords or configurations, yet, still receive updates if changes are made to the master version.

I know there's been a little discussion about this.  I'd like to add my voice the the request.
fields.summary: Support for "git update-index --assume-unchanged <file>"

fields.description:
When trying to cherry-pick or revert a merge-commit (ie. the summed up result of everything that happened in a feature branch/pull request, which is pretty much the only kind of commit we would like to cherry-pick/revert), SourceTree gives an error message like this:

error: Commit 5c2ce83708a98b60d7d8f1bbaa1e4053372a6dac is a merge but no -m option was given.
fatal: cherry-pick failed

Please add support for cherry-picking/reverting merge commits.
fields.summary: Merge commits cannot be cherry-picked / reverted in SourceTree

fields.description: If there are two commits made within the same minute on top of each other by two different people (requires a push in between), the sourcetree history/log view may display them out of order. This causes the graph to be messed up, but the underlying workings of git seem to be fine. See attached image.
fields.summary: Commit within same minute messes up the graph in the log/history tab

fields.description: I can't squash my commits in the Windows version, but when i try the same squash in the Mac version works well.
fields.summary: Squash commits

fields.description:
My team and I noticed that occasionally a SourceTree tab can become hosed in relation with the Subtree actions. For example if I issue a SourceTree Push/Pull, then the appropriate Push/Pull dialog doesn't appear at all. It looks as if SourceTree is not issuing the GUI action whatsoever.

We found a workaround here is to close all the tabs and re-open the concerned repository tab. Once this is done, the actions appear to work as normal and the appropriate dialog appears. This works until it gets scrogged again after which we repeat the tab closing/reopening process.
fields.summary: Subtree actions getting ignored

fields.description: Since you can choose between Openssh and Putty/Plink for Git, and Mercurial only uses Plink, it would make sense to have the option to be able to use 2 different keys (one for each option). At the moment, you would have to manually change the key if your working on a Git project using an Openssh key, then switching to a Mercurial project that uses a Putty key.
fields.summary: Option to use seperate keys for Git and Mercurial

fields.description:
The tabs of the opened repositories gets reshuffled.
The expected behaviour is that the position of the tabs does not change, only if the user would be able to reposition them manually (which is a feature request that is not yet available).
fields.summary: Tabs of repositories shuffled upon startup

fields.description: If a remote branch is deleted, it will be better if there is an option to delete local branch too, like http://stackoverflow.com/questions/13064613/git-how-to-prune-local-tracking-branches-that-do-not-exist-on-remote-anymore
fields.summary: Option to delete local branch if remote branch is deleted

fields.description: It seems I had double clicked on "File status" in the left column while SourceTree was trying to do some computation (I just checked out this repository and tried to go to "Working copy")
fields.summary: Unhandled excpetion (not localized)

fields.description:
This report conserns the version 1.5.2.

The UI of the interactive rebase is looking good and help a lot, but it is hard to use the edition of a commit. You can edit the message / title of your commit but not the files.

In my case, for example, I want to change the name of a function so in terminal I can review each of my previous commit change the name of that function in all of the files involved in this modifcation and use git commit --amend and continue my rebase.

It would be nice to have a stage or something like that which allow you to modify the file of a commit combine with the git commit --amend command.
fields.summary: Improvements to interactive rebase for edition

fields.description:
1. If the commit message does contain ascii control characters (first 31 characters) the whole commit is hidden.
- Commit is not shown in the history graph
- Commit can not be reached via parent link in child commit (although it is shown)
- Commit can not navigated to via "Jump to" 

However, the commit is perferctly visible via the command line client.

Screenshots
- the commit parent of commit "bMC: - Modul- und ObjectTabs wieder gleich hoch" is 3bcaf9ccfe (which is not shown)
- the parent of 3bcaf9ccfe is dd1f5ca90 (which actually is the next "Merge branch 'master' of //durin/git$/bms")
dd1f5ca

2. Actually the whole history is cut off after a few pages
- seems like SourceTree tries to find some parent commits and fails
- see 3rd screenshot.
This is actually a blocker, as the history can not be used.
fields.summary: History is cut off/Commits are not shown if message contains ascii control characters

fields.description:
My "rebase interactivley" get's "stuck" on whatever commit I right click on first, after loading SourceTree.

So if I right click commit aaabbb... it will say "Rebase children of aaabbb interactivley
And then if i right click bbbccc... it will still say "Rebase children of aaabbb interactivley.

Restarting SourceTree and then right-clicking bbbccc will show the correct message.

This is possibly related to SRCTREEWIN-1774
fields.summary: Rebase children of XXX interactively specifies wrong commit

fields.description:
OS: Windows 7
Refer to summary. I uploaded a attachment which is a logger.
fields.summary: When I was pulling a branch from origin bitbucket server, the app suddenly crashed.

fields.description: Hi, I would really like to see SourceTree become open source. I think this would help for adoption rates, while also greatly helping with quality and performance improvements.
fields.summary: Make SourceTree For Windows Open Source

fields.description:
As requested in answer to my stackoverflow (http://stackoverflow.com/questions/24637748/cant-push-subtree-using-sourcetree) post I'm posting this potential bug here.

Using a basic schema for git subtree I created 2 repository on Github: "project" and "framework" and made the followings:

- Clone "project" repository
- Add Subtree "framework" in a folder named "framework_dir"
- Navigate through "project/framework_dir" and create test.txt
- In the "project" working copy add test.txt to and commit it.

Pushing "project" gives the right result on the project repo. I then try to push this change to "framework" but it loops endlessly without giving any errors.

Same manipulation seems to work on the mac app on Mac OSX

Thanks.
fields.summary: Can't push subtree

fields.description: If you have an items in the tree view for a repository select (say a local branch under the "Branches" node) and you right-click to perform some action on that item, the view de-selects the item as the context menu pops up.  For things like deleting a local branch, this can be especially jarring because as the context menu pops up, you've lost all visual indication of what you're acting upon.  See screenshots of the behavior I'm describing
fields.summary: Right clicking on items in the tree view de-selects them

fields.description:
If you select all/many items from the Log / History panel of the "Working Copy Changes" window (either via Ctrl+A or selecting many via Shft+Click), there is no way to deselect them.  Changing views or windows doesn't even reset it.  Only restarting SourceTree seems to remedy it.

This is especially annoying when you're selecting many items wanting to do a bulk operation (Discard all) only to find out that a particular operation is not available across all items (because they are different change types).  When you do this, you're stuck and have to restart the app.
fields.summary: Can't de-select items in the Log / History panel of the Working Copy Changes window

fields.description:
I tried to rebase 2 latest not pushed commits (let name them [abcd] and [efgh]) in order to squash them in a single commit. I opened the interactive rebase dialog for those 2 commits, chose the latest one ([abcd]), pressed "Squash with previous", then I edited message of the squashed commit so that it became the same as the original message of [efgh]

Before
[abcd] "Latest commit message"
[efgh] "Previous commit message"

After
[efgh] "Previous commit message"

So i just wanted to "add" latest commit to it's parent leaving parent's message as is. But when i pressed Ok SourceTree crashed,
fields.summary: Crash in interactive rebase

fields.description:
Since some days Source Tree stopped showing the File status / Changed files from one minute to another when my Git server was not available for some hours.
The status bar still shows the amount of files changed, added, removed, etc.
If I click the "Add/Remove" Button and then Commit the changed files are shown in the commit window and can be committed.
fields.summary: File Status / Changed files not showing anymore

fields.description:
Merge branch 'test' into master and you will see the following commit log message:
Merge branch 'master' into test
rather than
Merge branch 'test' into master

This is very confusing for our team leads who are trying to catch up with the changes.
fields.summary: Merge branch commit log message is reversed

fields.description:
The most common mistake at our company (which recently switched from subversion) is the commit + push before doing a Pull. If you do a commit + push and there are changes that were not pulled from the remote the following things happen:
1. Commit executes
2. Push fails

You naturally run a Pull and the following things happen:
1. Your pending commit gets automatically branched away from the master branch.
2. The pending commits from the remotes get committed to the repository.
3. The previously created branch is automatically merged to the master branch.

We are all expecting for an error message saying that there are pending commits on the remote and a prompt asking for a Pull before running our Commit + Push. Using tortoise svn we were making use of this feature extensively.
Another possible solution to this problem would be to automatically run a pull before the commit + push however that might be too invasive.
fields.summary: Check for changes pending on remote before commit + push

fields.description: When "Always show full output" is enabled, trying to clear the checkbox for the "show full output" option in the commit result windows does not actually disable the option.
fields.summary: Cannot turn off "show full output" from commit result window

fields.description:
i know there are two default sort "Acestor Order" and "Data Order".
after play with sorcetree. I got what this really mean.
but for starter with git or sourcetree. After you do a commit or things change the tree, the tree graphic usually change to ..... another pose @@.
I mean the colume is sort by "Data" or "Ancestor", but the vertical branch is not fix or controlable. When i demo to starter, they always shock by the tree is change its....pose XD.(ok.. including me....) . we opine that it should just add a commit and why you change the branch to me~~~?(i know must be the Git behavior).
but if sourcetree have ability to sort branch vertically or fix it by ourself,
the Graph will more friendly(it alrealy good enough), and for git-flow user, they can really get a graphic like 
http://nvie.com/img/2009/12/Screen-shot-2009-12-24-at-11.32.03.png
fields.summary: sort the commit history tree by branch(vertically)

fields.description: My projects workflow encourages using "git cherry-pick -x" to annotate the source commit for a cherry-pick. It would be nice if SourceTree had an option to include "-x" in the "git cherry-pick" command. In reading the Git discussion around this, there is not, and doesn't seem to ever be a .gitconfig option to make this default.
fields.summary: Add "-x" preference for git cherry-pick

fields.description:
My latest push is at a 2014/06/27 15:24 and it successed.
But after 1 hours latter, my team member and I can't push any more.

following are my error messages:
----
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false push -v --tags origin master:master
Pushing to https://dy93@bitbucket.org/ueewbd/drawmagic.git

fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

Please make sure you have the correct access rights

and the repository exists.



Completed with errors, see above.
----
I have checked my access rights, it seems I have admin access right on this repository.
Any one knows what's happen?
fields.summary: Could not push/pull/fetch in sourcetree

fields.description:
As a SourceTree user, I want to quickly search through all files when using the search bar in the 'File Status' and 'Log / History: Uncommitted Changes' views so that I don't have to change the filter drop-down from 'Show Pending' to 'Show All' every time I want to find a file in the source that hasn't changed yet.

Conditions of Satisfaction:

When I type text into the search input for the first time, the filter drop-down changes to 'Show All' and the results are for all files in the project.

When I change the 'Show All' drop-down while there is search text, only files found in the new scope are shown.

When I remove the search text, the filter drop-down goes back to what it was before I added search text (generally this is 'Show Pending').

When I add search text again, the filter drop-down uses whatever scope I had in my previous search.

NOTE: I will often search through files only to find no results, then realize I need to change to 'Show All'. After I make this change I'll often forget that I've changed this until the next time I try to commit something and notice a ton of files, thinking they all need to be committed for some reason. It gets me every time. I'm sure I'm not the only one.

So really, committing changes should just 'Show Pending' and searches should really 'Show All' by default and if the user changes them, the new setting should be remembered, each filter setting separate from the other.
fields.summary: Search should use 'Show All' filter by default

fields.description:
Mac users can use ssh-add / ssh agent to manage ssh authentication. SSH authentication in Windows is not natively supported and require complex configuration using external tools; for example (Puttygen / Plink, or MingW / SSH / Git)

Add an option in Repository Settings for user to load private key, for Git remote SSH authentication
fields.summary: Manage SSH key authentication in Windows

fields.description:
There 2 major drawback for your great search feature.
1. You can only search by message, file changes and author, but most of times we need search by file name to get the information like commit date, etc.
2. When the project become huge, the searching period is getting longer, and there is no way to pause it. It keep running, and when try to stop it, all results disappeared. I guess that may not be what we want to see.

It will become more awesome, if you guys improved this. Thanks a lot for all your effects!
fields.summary: About search feature

fields.description:
SourceTree crashes immediately after I press the Open button in the file selection dialog for the Apply Patch action.
The log and the patch files are attached to this issue report.
The repository is https://bitbucket.org/aalmada/bonsaivideoplayer/
fields.summary: Crash on Apply Patch

fields.description:
We manage many repositories parallel (on project has several repositories for different parts; we manage several projects parallel and we do code reviews for other teams, ...). 

You can easily open a repository or a specific branch through jira or bitbucket in SourceTree - but if you than want to open your IDE with that code there is a break in the workflow. You can only open the source code folder over the menu or the bookmark.

The menu doesn't open the main folder of the repository but a random(?) one in it. And the bookmark is very hard to locate (if you have many of them).
fields.summary: Make opening of the sour code folder quicker (or even direct opening of solution in IDE)

fields.description:
SourceTree for Windows is occasionally crashing cloning a repository that contains submodules (might or might not be related, but I haven't seen it on submodule-less repos).

The same repository later opened correctly.

I'm attaching the exception log, having pruned project-specific information.
fields.summary: Occasional crash on SourceTree for Windows

fields.description: SourceTree crashed when open and closed feature florder
fields.summary: SourceTree crashed
SourceTree crashed after pull new branch and then minimizing branch list

fields.description:
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false revert --no-edit 233819a45ce6c5e6bee5d2c27b6d0d965f76edfd
error: Commit 233819a45ce6c5e6bee5d2c27b6d0d965f76edfd is a merge but no -m option was given.
fatal: revert failed


Completed with errors, see above.

fields.description: We are testing out a new GIT repository that was just imported from StarTeam and found that even after selecting "Date Order" the history does not sort correctly by the "Date" column
fields.summary: File history not correctly ordered in SourceTree 1.5.2.0 when "Date Order" is selected

fields.description:
Mercurial Embedded requires a config update on web.cacerts.

It should point to:
C:\Users\<user>\AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree\hg_local\cacert.pem

Instead it points to:
C:\Program Files (x86)\Mercurial\cacert.pem

Which doesn't exist.

---

I have Mercurial Embedded in my PATH (also Git Embedded) and I got no problems until now. I use it through Go's "go get" CLI.

{noformat}
$ go get code.google.com/p/snappy-go/snappy
# cd .; hg clone -U https://code.google.com/p/snappy-go D:\<go_code_path>\src\code.google.com\p\snappy-go
abort: could not find web.cacerts: C:\Program Files (x86)\Mercurial\cacert.pem
{noformat}

So I dug in, found that path didn't exist and manually updated Mercurial.ini, problem solved.

Hope it helps.
fields.summary: Mercurial embedded Mercurial.ini bad web.cacerts

fields.description:
"Log / History" show bad graph of merges with an ambiguous parent commit.

I have 2 commit (364318e and 1364364) ambiguous when asked for a the short SHA 36431 (git show 36431 says "short SHA1 36431 is ambiguous.")

Now, I merged the commit 364318e and commit aabbccdd.

Then, in SourceTree  "Log / History" graph, the merge commit is linked to 1364364 instead of 364318e.
fields.summary: incorrect merge in log graph with ambiguous SHAs

fields.description: When collapsing the remote branches tree view, SourceTree immediately crashes.
fields.summary: SourceTree Crash when toggling remote branch view.

fields.description:
Currently the title bar of SourceTree says just that: "SourceTree"
It would be useful if it were more like an IDE and say: "SourceTree: SelectedRepo - CurrentBranchName" and have the tooltip for the program's icon display it also.  That way it would be easier for users to ensure they're editing the correct branch.
fields.summary: Display current branch in SourceTree title area

fields.description:
1. Start a release using "Git Flow"
2. Start a hotfix 
3. Finish hotfix

Expectation:
Hotfix is merged into "release" and "master"

Reality:
Hotfix is merged into "develop" and "master", leaving the
fields.summary: Git Flow: Hotfix not merged into open release branch

Make Commit Text Area height resizable

fields.description:
When viewing the Working Copy Changes and they have been manually ordered by choosing the Path column, when the window is restored, from doing a stage or a commit, the ordering is lost.

An option to retain the ordering (sticky pin or a general option) so that that order is always shown would be very useful.

Currently, the order is odd/useless. It isn't alphabetical (which would help if the path was included). It isn't by path, so I suspect there is some magic ordering - not useful!

Regards,

Richard Quadling.
fields.summary: Do not reorder working copy changes on refresh

fields.description:
On SourceTree For Mac it is possible to select a specific branch in the Log / History tab. On Windows it is only possible to select All branches og Current branch.

Make it work like it does on Mac :-)
fields.summary: Abillity to select a specfic branch

fields.description:
The Search tab can be hard to discover. Suggest making it easier to find. 

Some possible options are-
* CTRL-F to switch to Search tab and focus on search box
* Add "Search" under "Edit" menu.
* Adding a right-click context menu item "Search" to the bookmarked repositories.
* Adding a right-click context menu item "Search" to a branch, to restrict searching on that branch.


Based off of question at https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/291035/how-to-search-through-commits
fields.summary: Requesting short-cut CTRL-F to focus on search tab

fields.description: It is very easy to stash changes, but no way to list, apply or pop stashed items
fields.summary: Stash Apply and Pop

fields.description:
I like sourcetree but overall it is very slow, the UX need to throttle user actions and cancel requests when user clicks around. 

Today, I got this for the first time, stuck on  "Loading...." when I hit F5

tsk tsk, great UI, but needs performance optimizations...
fields.summary: Source Tree is extremly slow and doesn't refresh

fields.description: Tooltips on the columns in the Log/History grid would be very useful. Description is the main one, but they could also be added on the Date, Author and Commit columns.
fields.summary: Add tooltips for columns in Log/History grid

fields.description:
The _merge_ commits should be displayed with a lighter text color in the commit history view.

The _stash_ web side already does it, thus effectively highlighting the non-merge commits.
fields.summary: Display merge commits with another text color

fields.description: Add a Search entry to the Edit menu, which, when selected, would do the same as Ctrl+F (see SRCTREEWIN-1782).
fields.summary: Edit -> Search

fields.description: Allow hitting Ctrl+F to activate the Search tab and focus the search field.

fields.description:
I'm attempting to add a number of files with very long path and file names to the Git index.  Most of the adds to staging work fine, but nine don't.  I've seen mention on the web that the type of error I'm seeing can occur when attempting to add a file that doesn't exist.  These files do exist.  When I attempt to stage one of these problematic files using the GUI, I get the following error:

{code}git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false rm -q -f -- "Contracts Docs Various/HPHC/HPHC HHSF223200910006I - Mini-Sentinel - Data Catalog/2012-09-23 HPHC - Mini-Sentinel - TO 006 Data Catalog/CII TO HHSF22301009T-0006 Maintenance and Enhancments Yr 4 10.09.2012.docx"
fatal: pathspec 'Contracts Docs Various/HPHC/HPHC HHSF223200910006I - Mini-Sentinel - Data Catalog/2012-09-23 HPHC - Mini-Sentinel - TO 006 Data Catalog/CII TO HHSF22301009T-0006 Maintenance and Enhancments Yr 4 10.09.2012.docx' did not match any files

Completed with errors, see above.{code}
fields.summary: "fatal pathspec: '<filename>' did not match any files" error when adding file to Git index
